page.title: 07UPHILL BOAT CENTRE
page.content: THE UPHILL BOAT CENTRE IS SITUATED UPON THE NORTH BANK OF THE UPHILL PILL.THE CENTRE,DISPITE BEING FAIRLY SMALL IS CAPABLE OF CATTERING FOR ALL THE BOATING NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY.BOATS CAN BE BOUGHT OR SOLD AT CENTRE BUT THERE ARE NO BOAT BUILDING FACILITIES.THE BOATS ARE MOORED IN THE PILL,A STREAM WHICH FEEDS INTO THE RIVER AXE,AND ARE STRANDED UNTIL THE NEXT TIDE.THE PILL ITSELF IS SMALL,NARROW AND MUDDY,AND CONTAINS A SEWAGE OUTFALL.THIS AREA EXPERIANCES EXSTREAMLY LARGE TIDE DIFFERENCE AND THERE HAS BEEN THE CONSTRUCTION OF NEW SEA DEFENCES IN THE FORM OF A RAISED BANK TO PREVENT FLOODING DURING BAD WEATHER SUCH AS OCCURED DURRING DECEMBER OF 1981.
